content: Some of the largest ocean waves in the world are nearly impossible to see. Unlike other large waves, these rollers, called internal waves, do not ride the ocean surface. Instead, they move underwater, undetectable without the use of satellite imagery or sophisticated monitoring equipment... and they can reach staggering heights - some as tall as skyscrapers.
source: Long A Mystery, How 500-Meter-High Undersea Waves Form Is Revealed
author: Geoffery Giller
